newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli jets rocket south Lebanon for third day.
newsitem.headline: Israeli jets rocket south Lebanon for third day.

text.p: Israeli planes raided suspected guerrilla targets in the highlands of south Lebanon for the third successive day on Sunday, security sources said.
They said two rockets were fired into the Jbal al-Botm ridges in the western sector controlled by pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) guerrillas just north of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone.
Israeli artillery gunners also pounded suspected guerrilla positions into the ridges with phosphorous shells.
There was no immediate word on casualties in the air raid, the third into Lebanon in 1997.

In the last two days Israeli warplanes carried out a series of rocket attacks on suspected Hizbollah targets in the Iqlim al-Toufah mountain ridge after guerrillas attacked Israeli outposts in the occupation zone, lightly wounding five soldiers, three of them on Saturday's attack.
Hizbollah is fighting a guerrilla war to oust Israeli troops and their local militia allies from a border zone they occupy in south Lebanon.
